title: Sausage Croissants Recipe
description: Sausage croissants start with refrigerated crescent roll dough, which is filled with savory sausage, onion, cream cheese, and jalapeño chile peppers.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Yeast Bread Recipes Sausage Croissants 4.5 (16) 11 Reviews 6 Photos These sausage croissants are so wonderful. I take them to every potluck, but my husband always makes me leave at least ten behind for him. Submitted by MistyTubbs Updated on September 10, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 6 6 6 6 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 32 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 32 servings 2 pounds pork sausage (such as Jimmy Dean) 1 onion, finely chopped 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened 2 jalapeño peppers, seeded and finely chopped 4 (8 ounce) packages crescent roll dough, unrolled and divided into triangles Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook and stir sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned, about 8 minutes. Drain. Combine sausage, onion, cream cheese, and jalapeños together in a bowl. Spoon about 1 tablespoon sausage mixture onto each crescent dough triangle; fold corners around sausage and roll up into a crescent, ending at the tip of the triangle. Place rolls on baking sheets. Bake in the preheated oven until rolls are golden brown, about 15 minutes. Cook's Note: May freeze after baking and reheat before serving. I Made It Print 39 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 210 Calories 15g Fat 12g Carbs 7g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 32 Calories 210 % Daily Value * Total Fat 15g 19% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 24mg 8% Sodium 494mg 21% Total Carbohydrate 12g 4% Dietary Fiber 0g 0% Total Sugars 2g Protein 7g 13% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 14mg 1% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 91mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sausage Croissants 01 of 06 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 06 Photo by  lutzflcat 04/24/2025 A keeper! Worth the effort Used Jimmy Dean Hot Sausage for the filling. The store was out of Pillsbury Original Crescents, so I took a chance and bought Sweet Hawaiian Crescents which I’d never had before. That Hawaiian crescent dough paired soooooo well with the hot sausage-jalapeno filling (sweet & spicy). And that will be what I buy the next time I make this recipe. Talk about great finger food or game day snacks that can be made in advance, this is it! A dipping sauce would be nice, just have to figure out which one—maybe bang, bang sauce. It took a couple times rolling the dough triangles to figure out how to to roll and keep the filling from not oozing out. I just flattened the wide end of the triangle a little with the palm of my hand, spooned the sausage mixture on that end, tucked in the sides and rolled, sort of like a burrito. EASY, and didn’t have one break open on me. I have some that are heading into the freezer. Thanks for sharing your recipe, we all enjoyed them. 03 of 06 Photo by  Patrick Knight 01/02/2021 04 of 06 Photo by  Julie McKusick Clark 12/03/2019 Very good recipe. I had left over croissants already made up. Did not have jalapeños so I used pepper jelly. Made up the mix and then put in oven to warm them up. Kids loved them. 05 of 06 Photo by  MamaMaru 04/16/2017 1 You’ll Also Love Cheesy Bacon Jalapeno Skillet Cornbread 24 Ratings Pretzel Bratwurst Bites 6 Ratings Keto Fathead Pizza with Chorizo and Salsa 4 Ratings Whiskey and Bacon Banana Bread 9 Ratings French Toast Sausage Fluffins 14 Ratings Best Sausage Gravy and Biscuits 17 Ratings Croissants 138 Ratings Cinnamon Roll Bunnies 22 Ratings Tacros (Croissant Tacos) 1 Rating Chef John's Chocolate Croissants 22 Ratings Traditional Layered French Croissants 39 Ratings Chef John's Croissants 48 Ratings Yummy No-Bake Cinnamon Rolls for Kids 65 Ratings Blueberry Turnovers 129 Ratings Cheater's Apple Strudel 31 Ratings Easy Maple Bacon Monkey Bread Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: MistyTubbs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Cook and stir sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned, about 8 minutes. Drain.;Combine sausage, onion, cream cheese, and jalapeños together in a bowl. Spoon about 1 tablespoon sausage mixture onto each crescent dough triangle; fold corners around sausage and roll up into a crescent, ending at the tip of the triangle. Place rolls on baking sheets.;Bake in the preheated oven until rolls are golden brown, about 15 minutes.
